result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trenton Dante Smith

records.addlTxt: Signed and Filed:  Order to Transport Forthwith.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Trenton Dante Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Trenton Dante Smith.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for competency hearing.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Julian Horowitz (Licensed Psychologist).  Exhibit 1 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense rests.  Arguments heard.  Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame with credit for 115 days time served.   The Court summarily denies the request for involuntarily treatment due to the premature filing of the request.  The Court orders DHS to observe the defendant for at least 5 days before filing another request and proposed order for involuntary administration of medication.   Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 40.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed:  Proposed Forthwith Order.

Defendant Trenton Dante Smith in court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Trenton Dante Smith in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case in court for return on doctor's report.  State does not dispute the findings and requests a hearing on the request for involuntary treatment.  Defense contests the report and requests a competency hearing.  Case adjourned for competency hearing in Branch 40.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed:  Motion for Order to Treat.
Received and Filed:  Request for order to treat.

Defendant Trenton Dante Smith in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Trenton Dante Smith in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a return on Doctor's report.  No report has been filed.  Court rescheduled matter.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Signed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

Defendant Trenton Dante Smith in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Trenton Dante Smith in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a return on Doctor's Report.  Court orders the defendant to be transported to the Department of Health Services FORTHWITH.  Order for Competency Examination signed and filed.  Case adjourned for a return on Doctor's report in Branch 40.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Proposed Order:  Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Received and Filed:  Dr. Report Dated June 21, 2022

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Trenton Dante Smith not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in Court for a Doctor's report return.  Wisconsin Forensic Unit requests more time to file report.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Dr. Report dated 05-26-2022
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Trenton Dante Smith in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Trenton Dante Smith in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trenton Dante Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.   Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
